snippet: Often victims of sexual assault have to convince the V.A. that they are disabled and entitled to compensation for post-traumatic stress disorder.
abstract: Editorial contends report by advocates for sexual-trauma survivors in the military paints a disheartening picture of unfair treatment; points out when a post-traumatic stress disorder claim is related to military sexual trauma, as opposed to combat or another reason, Dept of Veterans Affairs is less likely to approve it; calls on the military and VA to adopt reforms proposed in the report, like improving training and oversight.
lead_paragraph: Often victims of sexual assault have to convince the V.A. that they are disabled and entitled to compensation for post-traumatic stress disorder.
